website_summaries.verdict: Sometimes the simplest ways are the best ways, and the CH Hanson magnetic stud finder is proof of that. Only works with magnetic stud nails, but never runs out of power. Very attractive entry-level price point.
pros: Strong magnetic attraction to stud nails, few false readings
Only a simple S sweeping motion required
cons: Only detects metal nails, not wooden studs
Same effect possible with a strong standard magnet
Does not work with thicker plaster walls

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Stud Finder
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little tool. Obviously, using magnets for a stud finder isn't the perfect solution, but it is far superior to the electronic ones that I've used because it doesn't lie to you. By the way, when I say small, I mean small. This thing is tiny. Of course, there's no reason for it to be massive....but it still surprised me a little.
customer_reviews.author: The Choosy MooseTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: It works better then those other sonic type sensors
customer_reviews.text: Wow that is one strong magnet !!! It works better then those other sonic type sensors. But locating a nail or screw, doesn't necessarily locate the center of the stud. It's only as good as the accuracy of the one who installed the gypsum board in the first place. If he installed it at the edge, then you have a fifty fifty chance you may or may not hit the stud. I wish someone would come up with a combination of both types. You first locate the nail, then locate the stud edges.
customer_reviews.author: yrreti

customer_reviews.title: A Mostly Useless Magnet
customer_reviews.text: This is literally just a refrigerator magnet with a small levelling bubble. Maybe if your walls are super-thin or your studs are extremely susceptible to magnetism this will work for you, but for everyone else perhaps consider not using this product. Instead, I'd suggest spending the $20 or so and getting an electronic tool for finding studs. Because again, this product is ultimately just a useless refrigerator magnet cleverly marketed as some sort of wonder tool, that it clearly is not.
customer_reviews.author: T. John

customer_reviews.title: DUD finder
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this to do exactly what it’s advertised to do but it did not work in my situation what so ever. I have 100+ year old home with plaster and lath walls. I tried multiple walls and it didn’t locate any metal. Might work good for dry wall, but don’t purchase for use with plaster. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: theterribleone

customer_reviews.title: NO, this is a NAIL finder
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, for someone who has used an actual STUD finder in the past, this will be a huge disappointment. I am glad to hear that the 5-star reviewers had their walls built in absolute accuracy, but for me and my house the nails just show you where the nail was put, and says nothing about the stud that may or may not be behind them. Therefore, as a tool this particular item is just not useful for finding studs or locating the start/stop of any stud. But if you are looking for a nail in your wall, it is PERFECT!
customer_reviews.author: Jacinda & Darrell R. Owen

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: I have a brand new construction home. This product has yet to locate a single stud thru the drywall. It will only latch onto electrical lines or corners that are braced with steel. Waste of money. Perhaps newer homes have fewer nails in the studs? If so new homeowners beware.
customer_reviews.author: palm guru

customer_reviews.title: Pure Magic!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is the coolest stud finder I have ever used. No batteries, no hunting a million times back and forth to be sure you found a stud. My walls are and older plaster style and too thick for the "beeping" types. With this one you have to hunt a little but you can feel the faint pull of the nails. the magnets make it easy to store as well! Biggest downside...you cannot test this on yourself, have it go "beep" and say "Yupp... this stud finder found a stud..." You win some...you lose some...
customer_reviews.author: BryceJoseph

customer_reviews.title: You can buy a regular beeping stud finder at your ...
customer_reviews.text: You can buy a regular beeping stud finder at your local hardware store for two bucks more and save yourself the hassle. It's basically just two mildly strong magnets that require nails to detect the stud and takes forever to sweep across a wall and isn't strong enough. Even once you find where all the nails are there's no way to know when the stud actually begins and ends and is especially important when the nails themselves are not perfectly aligned or are staggered and or missing.
customer_reviews.author: Chocobo Sandwich

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This product looked like it might have some use but, I was wrong. Its supposed to attract the screw in the wall where its screwed into the stud but it doesnt. When is someone going to invent a stud finder that actually finds one? Don't waste your money, it's junk.
customer_reviews.author: Tucci

customer_reviews.title: Small and simple
customer_reviews.text: I didn't really read the description on this when I purchased it, I was looking for a simple and cheap stud finder, which is exactly what this is. I have never used a magnet to find nails, but it works really well. I have had electronic stud finders in the past and whenever I need them I always run into them having dead batteries. I am really impressed with how easy it was to find the nails with this, it is a super powerful magnet. I have standard drywall so I did not use this on anything thicker or on lathe and plaster, and for me it works well.
customer_reviews.author: mxtr185

customer_reviews.title: This didn't work at all for me
customer_reviews.text: Bought this due to the reviews, I don't know it's probably me, but every time I thought it pulled towards a stud it wasn't a stud at all. I ended up having to drill small holes until I found the stud, I even had someone else try to find a stud with it and it was a no go for them too. I will have to buy an electronic one instead.
customer_reviews.author: calcrnflakegirl

customer_reviews.title: Not for mobile homes
customer_reviews.text: Well this stud finder did not work for me. I'm not sure if it was because I have a mobile home and it can't find a nail for it to work. Would have returned it but lost original packaging. Will see if my son can use it in his home
customer_reviews.author: Ali Powell

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate enough for me and my situation.
customer_reviews.text: Not a fan of this little guy. It is good for finding metal in walls but I’m trying to find screws in wood studs. I put this little guy on the wall and found a spot I thought was a stud. I slid it to the right 5”, still stuck to the wall. Slid it to the left 10”, still stuck to the wall. I live in an old house. There might be chicken wire in the walls with plaster/cement over it. So, I found no studs and had to order a digital stud finder. This would probably work in newer construction but in old houses that you aren’t familiar with, it’s a crapshoot.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Best little tool
customer_reviews.text: I have an electronic stud finder, however while installing new 5” baseboard, I tied a string to this stud finder, attached a small bolt to the end, placed the stud finder on the wall, quickly finding a drywall screw, it stuck fast to the wall, I then let the string/bolt hang. The string passed directly over the baseboard showing the location of the stud underneath allowing me to shoot a nail without the slightest guessing, I hit every stud every time. A great little tool.
customer_reviews.author: usedsgm

customer_reviews.title: Best Product for the Job
customer_reviews.text: BEST product out there, and the most affordable! Why anyone uses a fancy electronic stud finder is beyond me when this little gadget is so simple and works flawlessly. It’s a simple magnet, so nothing to break or malfunction and it never runs out of batteries! One thing to note, this does use a super magnet, so DO NOT put this near your phone or any other electronics as it can definitely wreak havoc on them! I store mine conveniently on the refrigerator. Happy stud-finding!
customer_reviews.author: Summers Pearl

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes low tech is the best...and cheapest
customer_reviews.text: I had to locate the studs in a wall in order to cut a hole. I used this stud finder, as I've used this same stud finder over the decades. It locates the sheet rock screws and that is your stud. You can locate other screws in that same stud to get a better idea of the sides of the stud. I left the stud finder on the wall, and 2 months later, it was still on the wall, magnetically attracted to a sheet rock screw.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Sethre

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: My bedroom has textured walls and this didn't work at all. The surface must be absolutely smooth or it won't slide and you won't get a reading. Seemed to do better in the kitchen. I went to walmart and bought a cheap stud finder for 2 bucks more, even detects the edges of the stud. Works on all surfaces. Should have just went there to begin with.
customer_reviews.author: superego

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work so I returned it.
customer_reviews.text: I have used stud finders before so I'm well aware of how they work; it's not like they're rocket science anyway. I tried this all over my bathroom and could not find a single stud. I ended up doing it the old fashioned way by banging on the wall to find the stud. Not much to say about this other than it didn't work. At some point I'll purchase a more expensive one but for now I'll stick with the bang on the wall method.
customer_reviews.author: Char

customer_reviews.title: No more false readings
customer_reviews.text: I'm a professional garage door installer and finding studs is a must. I've been using electronic stud finders since the 90's and so tired of false readings, calibration, beeping and battery life... this thing changes all of that. So much more accurate and easier and lighter to use. The magnets are so strong that I have to keep it in it's own pocket in my toolbelt because it sticks to all my tools, nuts and bolts. I highly recommend this... there is a little trial period to which to get used to if so used to using electronic stud finders but once you do, you'll never go back. Best stud finder out there.
customer_reviews.author: nope

customer_reviews.title: No good
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what the deal is with this and how it's supposed to be used but I couldn't find a stud at all with it. I know the magnetic part was working but I slid it all across my wall and never had the slightest hint it was near a stud. I'm not sure how it's supposed to work but I found a better one with a laser guidance for pointing out the exact edge of the stud for just a few dollars more so this isn't worth it.
customer_reviews.author: RayGun

customer_reviews.title: If you're average with tools and handy work like myself (I'm a software engineer by trade) this is ...
customer_reviews.text: For the price, I don't think this can be beat. It is purely a strong magnet with a level. You run the stud finder across the wall until you feel it stick, knock to know the width, and draw lines to guide you with your install. I was able to install a TV wall mount and wall shelving around an apartment with ease. If you're average with tools and handy work like myself (I'm a software engineer by trade) this is a great addition for any small tool kit.
customer_reviews.author: CrispyFoo

customer_reviews.title: WOW - this stud finder actually works
customer_reviews.text: Over the years I've bought and trashed more than one stud finder because they didn't work. I had given up but my daughter recommended this one and it works every time. I especially like that it doesn't require batteries, like other brands do. It's also small in size so it easily fits in my took bag. I am a female in my 70s who likes to do projects around the house and this makes me smile every time I use it. Just yesterday I installed a floating shelf that required precise placement on drywall and this tool showed me stud placement in less than 3 seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Westgalady

customer_reviews.title: Just a strong magnet
customer_reviews.text: This product came with great reviews so I bought it. It's nothing more than a strong magnet with a small spirit level on top. Its main concept is to find a nail and magnetize to it. The magnet in the product assumes where the nail is - is where the stud is. Hmmm, but that's not always the case as some nails are so long and have not been fully nailed in to the wood work so you could still drill near there and end up going through the drywall and out to thin air. That said, unless they invent an x-ray machine for timber, this is the closest thing you'll find to finding studs.
customer_reviews.author: AM First Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Best in its class!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome, inexpensive stud finder! The best I've ever utilized. I used it to install multiple TV wall mounts, many fine art pictures, Monkey Bar chair hanger in my garage, and a couple of overhead heavy duty, garage storage racks. It's never failed! And it is so easy to use. I accidentally dropped it onto a concrete floor from 9' above, and it wasn't the slightest bit damaged or marred. It's really an exceptional tool. Kudos to the manufacturer/designer.
customer_reviews.author: James Clark

customer_reviews.title: LOVEEE! STRONG MAGNET!!! Soooo easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I’m not going to lie! I was so skeptical of this! Especially when I read how small it was. I almost didn’t buy it. But I figured, if it didn’t work, I could always return it. But wow!! This was exactly what I needed!! STRONG MAGNET! I did not have to dangle this with a string, like others suggested. I held it in my hand and slowly moved along the wall, up and down, side to side, and when it found a nail inside the wall - BAM - it attached real quick. So much so, that you have to gently yank it away from the wall, to get it to let go. LOVE THIS THING!! So convenient!!
customer_reviews.author: Jay4743

customer_reviews.title: Buy the stud finder.  If they are selling you anything else you will get the bait and switch
customer_reviews.text: Great to write that the plug testers is crap but it's showing a stud finder now. Dangerously says hot and ground are reversed. I am a professional electrician. Only seen this (reversed hot to ground) with these types of plug testers with an open neutral only a few times. This doesn't even trip a ground fault. I'm speechless (now)
customer_reviews.author: Joe Mama

customer_reviews.title: Hit or miss. Not recommended specially when laser ones are so much better
customer_reviews.text: Amazed by the number of people who says it works. I bought it because it was Amazon recommended and there were so many good reviews. I have tried using it multiple times it is almost impossible to accurately find a stud. May be I am too used the nice beeping laser pointing one which works amazingly well. It’s not to any of the several walls I have tried on. Plus you don’t know where the stud starts and where it stops. With the laser pointing one you can very easily tell what’s where, and usually those comes with a 9volt battery, rarely goes dead for most users. Regret trying this product.
customer_reviews.author: Syed

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a studfinder and both of my electronic ones had dead batteries. I vowed to never be in that position again. This thing works like a charm, it's dead simple. I've been hanging pictures and shelves and anchoring things to walls over the last couple of months and I've never been unable to locate a stud with this little thing. Combine it with a laser level and it's very easy to locate the entire length of a stud. I haven't touched my electronic stud finders since I got this thing - and they both have new batteries. I just like this better.
customer_reviews.author: AFTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Big smart idea. Makes me happy.
customer_reviews.text: Big magnet. Big nail. Big success. Many happy. Who wants to pay $30+ for a stud finder that is always broken the moment you need it. Seriously have you ever used an electric stud finder the you know... worked? I didnt think so. But a big rare earth magnet can find iron. Slap a logo and a leveler on it. I didnt hesitate to aquire one of these. It works much better then me knocking on the wall... looking all dumb. Hammering nail into empty hollow wall. Id imagine the only studs you wont find with this are weird ones that have to iron nailed or screwed into them.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: I love these!
customer_reviews.text: I love these. I have bought a few now. I've either had them "disappear" from a job site, or have given them away to friends who really wanted one. I find them very easy to use...don't know why some reviewers had trouble? Just move them gently back and forth across the wall, and you will feel them "grab" slightly. I usually move down the stud to find a second nail/screw to verify the screw is centered, in case one of them was not placed exactly centered on the stud. Works fine for me!
customer_reviews.author: Krowdog

customer_reviews.title: Great little tool.
customer_reviews.text: I volunteer to build houses for Habitat for Humanity and saw one of our team using this stud finder. I had never seen one before and found it to be a great product so I bought one and now carry it in my tool belt all the time. I think everyone on the team has used it at one time or another. The only difference between this product and the electronic stud finders is that the magnetic tool needs nail/screw heads to latch on to. I you are looking for a stud through drywall that doesn't have any nails in it then the electronic style is still a must.
customer_reviews.author: Tom C.

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Stud Finder!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of those little tools that you kick yourself in the butt and say, "Why did I think of this?", then sit back and watch the money roll in. Yeah, it's a small device but with some super strong magnets that just works like a dream. I went from using a standard electronic stud finder and several "near misses", to using this device and NO misses, hit the stud each and every time. I doubt I'll ever use the much higher priced electronic device ever again. Do yourself a favor and just buy it. You won't regret it. This would make an outstanding gift/stocking stuffer for anyone on your list.
customer_reviews.author: J. Conway

customer_reviews.title: A simple solution to finding studs.
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of laser type of stud finders not really finding studs consistently. I usually ended up taking a hammer to those. I came across this one ant thought why not. I am glad I did. The magnet will latch onto a sheet rock nail/screw when you slide the unit across the wall. It grabs onto the nail/screw then there is a little level that will allow you point the pointed end perfectly vertical to be able find the stud for nailing/screwing the length of the found stud. Simple/easy low tech and better
customer_reviews.author: bslow47

customer_reviews.title: Does What it says....
customer_reviews.text: The back has a rubber coating around the edge to prevent scratching the paint, which is great. The magnets at the top and bottom are strong and when it feels a screwdriver behind the wall, it WILL FIRMLY tell you "Here!". It's strong magnet will even hang off the nail behind the wall. For most applications, you won't need anything more techno fancy than this. Most users seem to agree as this product is always very highly rated. The bubble leveler is also a nice handy feature to have!
customer_reviews.author: David R.

customer_reviews.title: So Much Easier
customer_reviews.text: This little magnet is much easier to use than a traditional electronic stud finder - which are usually pretty unreliable. The only downside is that it only picks up on nails in the stud, which hopefully are dispersed throughout the stud vertically so you can map out the stud. Unfortunately, all the nails in my studs were across the bottom of the wall so it was unclear whether there was a vertical or horizontal stud. I would probably use this in the future to map out where nails are and then follow up with an electronic stud finder to see specifically where the edges are (without punching holes in the wall with a drill bit).
customer_reviews.author: HeavyDiaper

customer_reviews.title: Love this stud finder!
customer_reviews.text: The first objective is to find a stud, or that is, the nail or screw that is in the stud. Because of the power of the magnet, it does this in spades! Another benefit I like it how small it is. I am able to keep it in a small pouch, (away from my nails) in my tool belt, making it very accessible. (They ask about accuracy? My guess that's regarding the level feature. This is a stud finder, not a level.) I have had mine for about 5 years now, and I think it will out last me! I am now giving them as gifts to my adult children.
customer_reviews.author: Will Chandler

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this little thing!!
customer_reviews.text: A co-worker on a job-site showed me one of these and I thought it was the neatest gadget so I got one for my hubby. He thought it was cool but didn't really see a use for it. It lived in his tool bag for months until we started working in some condos with double thickness sheet rock and his usual stud finder wasn't good enough. I dug out this amazing little magnet and zipped it across the wall finding the studs by locating the sheet rock screws. Now hubby had me order 2 more as we are are all always having to share it. It's a very useful tool.
customer_reviews.author: cmcl

customer_reviews.title: Did not work on plaster walls
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this prior to installing a tv wall mount. You can definitely feel the "pull" toward the nails inside the wall, but we drilled 21 times (!!!) and never found a stud that this thing indicated existed. Borrowed a neighbor's stud finder (the battery operated kind) and it was dead on. Do not recommend this one for plaster walls.
customer_reviews.author: lizard

customer_reviews.title: Not a normal studfinder
customer_reviews.text: I was very confused when I first opened this. I had figured that I had simply found the most inexpensive stud finder. As soon as I took it out I started feeling around for the usual buttons, however this has none. No batteries. No screen. No beeping (thank god). You just move this thing along the wall and it will find drywall screws that attached to a stud. This stud finder will hold itself to a ceiling, wall, whatever. The magnet was the biggest surprise here. I couldn't grasp how easily it held onto a single metal screw. This thing works great, will last a long time, and doesn't need batteries! 5/5
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Simple and works
customer_reviews.text: This stud finder is so easy to use with its strong magnet! The concept is simple. It finds any magnetic objects (such as nail that holds the dry wall to the studs) behind or on the drywall. It is not design to tell you what’s there but more of some metal parts are there. So if you intend to find EVERYTHING behind the wall, this is not for you. But if you just simply want to have better assurance for stud location, this is the one! I have no problem recommend this to all my friends.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Simply awesome
customer_reviews.text: I got this little marvel delivered and within a minute I found all of the metal screws/nails in my wall; something my $40 electronic stud finder could not do. The magnets on this are something to behold; the little thing hangs on the wall and you can trace the stud up and down as it grabs on. My electronic stud finder had studs shifting diagonally up the wall. I thought, there's no way a simple magnet could do better. I was wrong. This thing is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Bungholio

customer_reviews.title: Handy, Simple and Reliable
customer_reviews.text: The problem with all the stud finders I've had in the past is they were inconvenient to use, or bulky, or batteries had died. This has been dead simple and handy when I need it. Small, but powerful. Easily found the stud (nails) and hung on the wall so I didn't even have to use a pencil. Never have to worry if the batteries are good or not. Packed it right in my drill case for the next time due to the small size. The level bubble comes in handy to make sure you are straight. Nothing fancy but everything I need and that's just perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Derf 0__o

customer_reviews.title: Who knew something so simple could bring so much joy!
customer_reviews.text: Apparently when you get over the age of 30, these are the types of things you enjoy. Well, speaking for myself anyway! My mom and I always have a hard time with our battery powered stud finders on the walls of our homes because they are 100+ years old. I found this to be an interesting gift for her. When she used it, it instantly picked up on the studs and we used both battery powered and this at the same time. Battery powered didn’t read anything. It literally sticks to the wall! I loved the one I got her so much I bought one for myself!
customer_reviews.author: Steff8722

customer_reviews.title: Very Powerful Magnet
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why they call this a stud finder. It is designed to find nails nailed into a stud. I live in an old house where it is near impossible to use a conventional stud finder because the plaster and horizontal lathing conceals the location of the horizontal wall studs. This tool does a great job at locating the nail heads and than I probe deeper by nailing a finish nail to confirm if a stud is indeed at that location. I measure from there, 16" on center to see if the next stud follows the standard stud location. I keep this tool affixed to my refrigerator to have it on hand whenever I need it.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Michael Boscarino

customer_reviews.title: Works through plaster
customer_reviews.text: This things awesome. I wanted to hang a hammock in my room and needed to know where the studs were in order to install the eye bolts. Before getting it I tried a digital stud finder but it wasn’t reading anything, I’m assuming because of the plaster walls. This thing worked great, the magnets are super strong and when I ran it across the wall I could really feel it pull when I came near a nail. When zeroed in on the nail It was strong enough for me to let go without it falling. I screwed in the eye bolts, attached the hammock, and now I’m hangin’ in my room. Super stoked
customer_reviews.author: RGC

customer_reviews.title: Old school tech beats new school
customer_reviews.text: The inexpensive, reliable, simple magnetic tech that doesn't require batteries and will outlast any electronic stud sensor. This should be your first choice. I used it to mount four TV wall mounts with accurate results each time. It's small and tough with a much-needed bubble level. Sometimes new school technology isn't always better. P.S. I lost the first one that I purchased four years ago and when I moved into my new place to remount the tv wall mounts, I didn't think twice and ordered a new one. Small enough to keep inside my power drill case along with my drill.
customer_reviews.author: SnugglesTheHusky

customer_reviews.title: This is a magical little tool
customer_reviews.text: This is one of those things that, as soon as I bought it, I looked back over the last 10 years of my life and kicked myself for not having it before. It is tiny (maybe the size of a large square pencil eraser or a matchbox car) and doesn't require batteries or power. You will have absolutely no trouble finding the studs- the magnet inside is so powerful that if you lightly swipe it around on the wall it will jump onto the nail - this will remain strongly magnetized to the wall on it's own power (which is actually where I have a tendency to store it ;-)).
customer_reviews.author: WhenInRome

customer_reviews.title: Works good enough
customer_reviews.text: This product was great especially for the price. I really liked the leveler. I gave the 'ease of use' 4 star because it was hard to find studs by holding it. I followed one reviewer's advice -- attached a string and swung it against the wall -- and the finder found the studs easier that way. I was going to buy a strong magnet (cost around $5) and glue them together with a string (advice on youtube) but this was much easier - good product.
customer_reviews.author: Salmy Udin-Underwood

customer_reviews.title: Great backup for situations where the electronic models won't work.
customer_reviews.text: I had a laminated counter top that I needed to route some t-track groves in. The top east screwed to a plywood frame before it was laminated and I neglected to track the placement of screws beforehand. I needed to know the exact location of the hidden screws before routing. This device worked great. I've since used it to locate furring strips attached to a block wall to which a double layer of drywall had been attached. An electronic stud finder was not reliable here but this device saved the day.
customer_reviews.author: Stan V.

customer_reviews.title: Back to basics
customer_reviews.text: I own at least 5 electronic stud finders. Once one of the Zircons actually mid-led me into drilling into a PVC pipe when mounting a wall-hung cabinet. I've lost complete confidence in the electronic stud finders to the point that I always verify with a small nail before screwing in anything. But I'm always afraid of nailing into a mains wire, so it's an educated guess with very gentle tap each time. It's back to basics for me, and this things works 100 times better than it's cheaper cousins with the weak arrow magnets.
customer_reviews.author: pmoy

customer_reviews.title: Simple and easy to use and it WORKS
customer_reviews.text: A carpenter who installed some cabinets used this to find studs and did so effortlessly. I was amazed and had to get this. I’ve had several stud finders and with so many false readings and studless holes later this has helped make the process a lot easier. I would use this to confirm a stud via screws and use the electronic stud finder to have a better estimate for stud size and width (handy for tv wall mounts etc) but this definitely saves the headaches and guesswork of electronic finders which give me inconsistent readings. It’s possible user error for the electronic stud finders but this helps a ton
customer_reviews.author: Confused

customer_reviews.title: Simple and effective
customer_reviews.text: I love this little device. When combined with an electronic stud finder, you have everything you need to determine where studs lie behind your walls while marking the location. I test the area first with either this device or a stud finder, confirm the location between the 2 devices, then let this hang on the confirmed vertical stud line (and at the location of the horizontal breaker if helpful for a 'cross-hair' approach). With this hanging on the wall, I have a constant reminder of where the stud is. Great device and value for money.
customer_reviews.author: CAP

customer_reviews.title: Best value for your conscious budget
customer_reviews.text: This thing is super easy to use and very budget friendly! I am guessing logic behind the magnet finder is that studs usually have nails in it at some place or another so you gotta waive this thing all across your wall until you find that sweet spot and then the stud is anywhere above and below that spot. Works every time for us so far and have had no false positives so for that reason plus the price, I think this is the best product on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Sapawa

customer_reviews.title: htis is NOT a stud-finder -- it is a nail and screw finder -- strong magnet only
customer_reviews.text: Thought it would be a convenient stud-finder, but it is a nail and screw finder = a really strong magnet. It does NOT find studs - just the screws and nails that are probably in studs -- but that isn't always the situation, especially in smaller spaces. And don't know what the nail or screw is into, or how deep or if at an angle or whatever... Stud finders show where the stud starts and stops -- this definitely does not. If you are searching for metal, this is great -- I should take it to the beach.
customer_reviews.author: Doctor Rick

customer_reviews.title: Best stud finder. Throw those home depot beep beep red light things away
customer_reviews.text: I probably would trust the bubble level as a last resort and even id probably just eye things up. As far as being a stud finder this thing does that excellently. People see it. They like it. I give it away. Then I'm back to amazon buying more. It finds nails/screws in the framing so I know where to shoot my trim gun nails! Buy it. You won't be disappointed by this thing whatsoever. Unless the magnet finds nothing. Then I'd be asking how your sheetrock stays in place lol
customer_reviews.author: Jussy

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't needed a stud finder in a lot of years and after all this time I had no idea where my old one was. This little rascal is great! Nice strong magnet that doesn't just indicate where the nails in the studs are (which was all my old one did...poorly), it glues itself to the wall. Just for the heck of it, I measured over 16 inches, made a mark, and ran this unit near the mark. Zap, stuck to the wall again, right over my mark. For the price, works for me! The level is a nice feature, too. I'm quite pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Shadow Flower

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: So this thing has two really strong magnets in it, and you run it along the wall until it passes over a nail head and you feel the detector pull towards the nail. That's it. It's so strong it would stay attached to the wall via magnetism if I let go which surprised me. Well boy does it work well. I had to hang some hooks and finding the studs was super easy. I didn't need to use the level so I was less sure how that factors into things, but if you just need to find the studs in the walls it couldn't be any simpler.
customer_reviews.author: C.C.

customer_reviews.title: Great stud finder.  Fool proof!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Mounted a TV for the first time and was a little nervous since electric stud finders seem to always give me varying indications. The magnetic stud finder does not guarantee the center of the stud but if you find a nail with the magnet, you can move up and down to confirm that you've in fact located the stud. After finding the nail, I grabbed a pair of pliers to hold a T-pin and started poking tiny holes about 1/4"-1/2" apart on the left and right of the point where the magnet stuck. This told me exactly where the stud started and ended, allowing me to put the big lag bolts in the center of the stud.
customer_reviews.author: AW

customer_reviews.title: Finds Metal, not so much studs
customer_reviews.text: Don't get me wrong this will find metal, and potentially the nails/screws in the possible studs. However this becomes a guessing game to assume where the center of the stud is and what direction the stud is going. Obviously on a basic wall the stud is most likely up and down, however if you're trying to install a ceiling rack in the garage I would buy a real stud finder that shows the center of a stud.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Needs a smooth backing...
customer_reviews.text: I was super excited about this when I ordered. What arrived was a very small almost thumb size stud finder. I don't like how noisy it is running across the wall in "S" patterns to find a stud; it's almost like it must be putting scratches in the wall because there is no felt or anything to make this thing slick or even smooth. I thought this was the answer to my problems, but it's just a couple rare earth magnets, very small, and the surface against the wall is rough...I haven't successfully used this to hang one picture in this new apartment so pretty disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: ChadEric27

customer_reviews.title: Great stud finder that doesn't require batteries
customer_reviews.text: This works by finding the metal screw in the stud via the magnet which gives you the location of the stud through the wall. I've used one that have 3 lights that all light up when you're on the stud but it requires batteries and wasn't always that accurate. I like that I don't have to worry about the batteries, that it stays mounted on the stud via the magnet, and it's portable. The only issue is that since it's only looking for the screw and not the actual stud, you're just going to have to do a little more work to find it.
customer_reviews.author: Carfo

customer_reviews.title: Okay but
customer_reviews.text: Not as good and some say. Out of 3 magnetic stud finders I bought, this one worked the best, but it found 1 nail in the wall after several minutes of searching. I found that my 20+ year old electronic stud finder was more accurate than this was. I had thought my old Stanley stud finder was not accurate but it was. Will keep this because it's not worth the time (and due to Covid) to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Deb S

customer_reviews.title: They aren't kidding about the magnets
customer_reviews.text: Most stud finders use magnets. I was accustomed to the kind that have a little free turning magnet, like a compass needle. This is not that kind of magnet. These magnets are so strong they pull your hand to the nails. I let it stick to a metal rod and I had a hard time prying it off. This works as advertised. Keep it away from any electronic devices or chipped cards in your wallet. It might come in handy if you want to wipe your hard drive.
customer_reviews.author: Sheherazahde

customer_reviews.title: Not a great layman's stud finder.
customer_reviews.text: I'm sorry. I just didn't understand how to use this thing. Was it supposed to stick to the wall without a stud? Because if that's the case it did not work at all. While I can appreciate the small size, it was so small I somehow managed to lose it before I got a chance to fully use it. I tested it a few times before I actually hung the pictures I bought the finder for, but it was so small that I lost it within a week. Maybe this is better suited for someone who builds houses. But for a one-in-while every day picture hanging apparatus, this was not all that useful.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda A. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great, simple product
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want to spend a lot of money to find studs and I didn't need any complicated tool for locating wiring and plumbing. This fit the bill! Simple as it gets and works like a champ. Magnets are strong and locate nails like nobody's business. If you're looking for something easy to use and cost-effective, look no more. 100% recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Alex F.

customer_reviews.title: Easiest way to find studs
customer_reviews.text: This tool is compact and makes it one of the easiest ways to find studs behind your drywall. It does so by locating nails or anything magnetic. The only concern I have with it is that it is not able to scan deep behind the drywall, and you could potentially drill a hole into electrical wiring or pipes. However, for the price and its size, it works very well in a pinch. If you found this review helpful, please hit the "Yes" button to encourage me to write more. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Photographer | Tech Pro | Outdoor EnthusiastTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: The most accurate stud finder you can buy!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely, absolutely more accurate then most of the electronic stud finder’s I have and I have some of the best and most expensive ones you can buy! When it finds the nails or screws in the drywall it locks on like an alligator. I think it has some of the strongest magnets for its size that I have ever used and the tool is just damn right cheap. Now that I’ve used it I would’ve paid twice as much for it and, as a matter fact, I bought additional ones for my sons to use in their own house or apartment!!
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Incarnato

customer_reviews.title: My preferred option over the electronic ones
customer_reviews.text: I'm really impressed with this after using electronic stud finders for years and with inconsistent results based despite calibration or the old banging on the wall method. This device is so simple and effective. I immediately found the screws in the studs all over the house. The only downside is that there is a bit of friction on the wall from the black rubber edge but it didn't leave a mark and not really a problem. Bottom line is that I'm glad I got this instead of an electronic device.
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: I should have bought one YEARS ago!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea why I never owned one of these before. Living in a house with textured plaster over drywall, it’s very tough to find studs with normal electronic stud finders (trust me, there are dozens of hole drilled where the stud was SUPPOSED to be and wasn’t...) This magnetic stud finder found the stud in seconds and it was right on, 100% of the time. If you’re reading this and trying to decide if you need one, STOP. Just buy it, okay? Trust me, you’ll like it!!!
customer_reviews.author: David Schwind

customer_reviews.title: Simple Accurate Essential Tool
customer_reviews.text: This product is so simple. I own electronic sophisticated stud finders but this is my preferred go to tool. The powerful magnet attracts strongly to screws and nails behind drywall/sheetrock. Once you're attached to a screw, which should be on a stud, just adjust the finder until it's level. Once you're lined up, draw a line on the top and bottom marks of the tool. Now use a larger level to draw a line on your newly found stud.
customer_reviews.author: Ida

customer_reviews.title: It is a good product
customer_reviews.text: What's to read. For paneling and sheet rock it is dead on. But I bought an old house that has been updated. It was looking for the ceiling studs. It would pull towards metal but not lock on. Then it did lock on and I left it hanging while I got a pencil. I marked it and went to drive a nail to see if it was a stud. Nope, don't know what but it never would lock on it pull any where in that area. Humm. But I would not return as it does work great with the other materials I listed.
customer_reviews.author: James Baker

customer_reviews.title: It works fine locating vertical studs in walls.
customer_reviews.text: I needed to locate the vertical studs walls hidden behind drywall. Drywall is hung via nails and/or screws. This finder made the task very easy. Magnet is strong, level is handy. I still use my electronic stud finder for more complex situations, e.g. a magnetic is relatively useless if it detects electrical conduiting or iron and galvanized water pipes behind the walls. But for average jobs e.g. location of 16" OC studs, it's very handy and fast.
customer_reviews.author: Manhattan Beach

customer_reviews.title: Easy!
customer_reviews.text: This works great overall, easy to use and strong magnets! Sometimes more features = more things that can go wrong, but this is so easy to use. In my condo there is a fire wall on the side I share with neighbors and sometimes it's a little tougher to find the studs in (2 layers of 5/8" sheet rock), but otherwise it's the easiest thing to use! One question I haven't been able to answer is why sometimes I feel it repel when I'm holding it over a certain area of the walls...
customer_reviews.author: S.A.L.

customer_reviews.title: The last and only stud finder you will ever need
customer_reviews.text: This is the only stud finder you will ever need! No batteries required and you will seriously go around finding studs around your house every two seconds because you can. At least I did. We have a hole in our wall where my husband accidentally drilled into a drain pipe thinking it was a stud and had to cut out our wall due to the water damage. We needed a no-fail solution and this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Izzie B.

customer_reviews.title: Great tool, but you do need a Sensor as well.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool with a powerful magnet. The only downside is that it would definitely difficult to work with this as a standalone tool. I had to buy the Franklin Sensors FS710+02B ProSensor 710+ Professional Stud Finder with Built-in Bubble Level and Ruler, Blue to actually finalize the stud locations. As the CH Hanson is magnetic, it isn't totally reliable for finding wood studs. But it does a great job of rouging out the locations first and finalizing with the Franklin. The magnet is very powerful. I took the hint from another reviewer and used this as a pendulum, swinging from a twine, to locate the rough locations. Recommended for purchase.
customer_reviews.author: SKID NY

customer_reviews.title: its the simplest and also the best
customer_reviews.text: I've used electronic stud finders for a while but decided to go back to basics after getting frustrated with the fancier ones. And let me tell you this works soooo much better than the electronic ones I've used. The magnet on this thing is incredible and you can locate stud nails in literally 3 seconds. The best part is you're guaranteed you have a stud there, unlike with the electronic ones where you never really know for sure. Do yourself a favor and get this, save some money, and be much happier.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, inexpensive, lets you work hands-free
customer_reviews.text: This is light enough to stick to the nail you find in the stud, so you can measure and mark hands free. It also does a better job of finding difficult studs -- the ones in walls that still have plaster underneath the wallboard. I have a fancy electronic stud finder, and it is great on normal wallboard walls. It is almost useless on the ones with the plaster. - that's why I bought this one.
customer_reviews.author: MBS

customer_reviews.title: No question about it - BUY IT!
customer_reviews.text: Wow. First of all, it’s tiny. I wasn’t expecting it to be THAT small. Plus, I kinda questioned how accurate it would be. Well, the internal magnet is really strong. I mean REALLY strong. And because I don’t use a stud finder that often, I like that I don’t have to worry about batteries. No worries about misplacing it. Just stick it to the side of the fridge! I also like the rotating level. Can’t wait ‘til I need to use it, but just goofing around, it seems to be very accurate. This would be a great little gift!
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: Will Detect ANY metal behind walls no just studs
customer_reviews.text: PROS: This product is great and easy to use. I love the size as I can easily bring it with me anywhere and storage well. CONS: However, the accuracy is not too good as it can detect a nail or any metal tube and let you think is a stud. It will just attract any metal behind your walls. Just be careful while using it because you hit something else.
customer_reviews.author: Carlota Veras

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Tool
customer_reviews.text: I love this little tool, powerful magnets find nails/screws easily and no batteries to die in the middle of a job. I wish that there was a version with a laser that could shoot a line or a dot to transpose the stud locations from the middle of the wall to the top or bottm. This is a very useful tool for moulding work when you want to ensure that you're nailing into a stud or ceiling joist.
customer_reviews.author: Kahlua0619

customer_reviews.title: Stop here, search no more, buy this stud finder!!!
customer_reviews.text: This stud finder is better than any other. It can’t miss. The only thing it can’t do is drive the nail in for you. Also a good way to figure out how off the builder was on 2x4 spacing 🤦🏼‍♂️. In any case, quit fumbling with gadgets and 100 page stud finder manuals. No batteries, but this magnetic stud finder will find the nail or joint support in the stud. Get one!
customer_reviews.author: Boiler Boss J

customer_reviews.title: Best Stud Finder EVER
customer_reviews.text: Read about this in Family Handyman. My first reaction was that the nails being so far apart, how was this magnet going to find them. I zigzagged across the wall near where I thought the stud might be and, within seconds, the stud finder stuck to the wall (it found a nail). I will never go back to me old/unreliable stud finder. HOW DID I EVER GET BY WITHOUT SUCH A SIMPLE TOOL!
customer_reviews.author: Robert B. Hirsch

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing, didn't work.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to believe that something so simple (seemingly) & cheap would actually work & that all those who spend more get not much more. I was wrong. It's definitely difficult to use as a STUD FINDER. It doesn't have any sort of warning that it even found a nail, just a SLIGHT pulling sensation. I was very disappointed that there isn't some sort of warning when it's found a nail as the magnetic sensation is very faint as it is going through paint and drywall.just the product is poo poo.
customer_reviews.author: TINA DEMATTEO

customer_reviews.title: So Small But Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Some reviewers said that they had a hard time finding the studs with this. Not me. It took me all of 5 seconds to find where a stud was located using this handy little gadget. The magnet part worked great! I didn't want to spend $30 or more on a stud finder, and I'm glad I bought this instead. It did it's job and then some, helping me find studs all over my new home. I recommend it. Note that it is small, so don't be surprised.
customer_reviews.author: PJH

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, perfect stud finder
customer_reviews.text: I needed to install a tv mount on my wall and lost my old stud finder that had indicator lights on it. I figured I would go with this one because on multiple sites it was the best rated and the best price. Magnet is strong & guides you to the nails in the studs. Easy to mark the wall with a pen and I found the stud I needed quickly and accurately. To find the stud, just go over the wall in an "S" shaped pattern. No need for expensive stud finders with lasers and add-ons. This was perfect and doesn't need batteries or extra things that cost money.
customer_reviews.author: M Preston

customer_reviews.title: Awesome magnetic power and very small
customer_reviews.text: I am not a very good DIY'r and well I had a stud finder and it beeped just about everywhere? So where were the studs? I purchased this based on reviews and price. It is exactly as everybody is saying. Awesome stud finder that is super easy. It does hit nails and not proven studs but with testing above and below the studs are quite easy to find. Love the idea, product size, price, size. Definitely worth the purchase and then some.
customer_reviews.author: Areviewer

customer_reviews.title: Wow, really does work well for my old walls and floors
customer_reviews.text: I have an old house with lathe/plaster walls and thick floors. It's about one inch from the top of the floor boards down to the subfloor boards where the nail heads would be. Some of these magnetic stud finders claim they only work up to 0.75 inches. This one practically snaps to the nails where the floor joists are (1" down), leaving no guesswork to it at all. For the plaster walls it takes a little more searching, and making sure to hold it just slightly away from the wall to feel the magnetic pulls while scanning left and right. Still, I feel it's way better than trying to use a random strong magnet or electronic stud finder.
customer_reviews.author: John B

customer_reviews.title: like me, you have lost the pencil
customer_reviews.text: This stud absolutely finds studs based on the powerful magnet principle. As long as there are ferromagnetic screws/nails in the sheetrock, this baby will find them, and that which they go into, wood. Hint: attach a one foot string to open end of tool and gently swing in an arc pattern. Once a screw is located, this baby will stick to the wall, (yup, no hands), giving you a chance to find a marking tool if, like me, you have lost the pencil . . . again. Before the CH Hanson, I briefly went with electronic finders which I think operate purely on voodoo- reliability depends greatly on planet alignment and sacrificing a good chicken.
customer_reviews.author: a.walker

customer_reviews.title: Didn't find a single stud
customer_reviews.text: This wasn't able to find a single stud throughout any of my walls. The only moment it worked was when I would go over the door casings and not throughout the entire door casing. I doubt my house has absolutely no studs deeming this ineffective.
customer_reviews.author: Paulina T.

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have
customer_reviews.text: I have used stud finders quite a bit over the years and always found them to be hit or miss. I know they are not perfect, but if you use this with them, you can't miss. The magnets are very powerful so you will easily hit the nail or screw heads every time. I read a review on this and totally agree that it works much better if you tie a string to it and let it dangle while moving along the wall. I highly recommend this Magnetic Stud Finder to go along with your electronic one.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Moses

customer_reviews.title: Useful for any wall installs
customer_reviews.text: This was a better device than other stud finder I've used. It's not perfect because all it does is find the nails in studs. But those are generally towards the middle of the stud. This is much more accurate to where the nail is than the devices that light up 8 different LEDs and you have to choose which LED might be the correct one without using your x-ray vision. A great tip I read is to tie this to some string and swing it along the wall to find the stud quickly. It strongly attaches when in the vicinity.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Bieselin

customer_reviews.title: Definitely does it's job
customer_reviews.text: Honestly I was very hesitant about getting this small "magnet". After watching some You Tube reviews I decided to get it for a tv mount project specifically. It worked as described, It's not fancy and it's not gonna show you the blueprints of your mouse home, but it surely will find those studs, even in thick walls full of plaster and paint. I recommend it. If you don't have experience, please check some tutorials or call that "handy" friend before drilling deep, you don't want to damage your pipes or electrical circuits.
customer_reviews.author: Sebastian

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised, one caveat about stud center.
customer_reviews.text: Works really well at locating studs. I would give 4.5 if I could. The only thing I don't like about this is that the ability to "find the center of the stud" assumes that when the drywall was hung, the installer placed their screws/nails near the stud center. If not, you're going to split or blow out the stud when you screw in your lag bolts for whatever project you're working on. For quick and reliable stud finding, I'll use this. But, to find the true center, I will still use an electronic one to verify the edges.
customer_reviews.author: DVStang

customer_reviews.title: This is a Winner for finding the stud in plaster thick walls !!!
customer_reviews.text: My CH Hanson just arrived and id hoped this would solve the problem of finding the stud to mount my flat screen and id tried everything stud finders, Magnets, nothing worked on my 1945 plaster walls which are really thick so this was my last least expensive reasonable hope, I tied a string on the end and just held it close enough where it would remain flat against the wall because if you use too much string it rolls and won't remain flat if your walls are imperfect, It only took a few seconds and it found the stud and i even let go of the string and to my surprise it held on! Great Product !!
customer_reviews.author: stevie bleu

customer_reviews.title: Best stud finder I have used!
customer_reviews.text: I have used other stud finders and seen some cool very expensive ones but this is soo cool so easy to use and no where near the same price an expensive one is. The best thing is there's no guessing when it's on a stud it's on it. Since it uses magnets it's easy to tell when it finds a screw on a stud. I wish I would have had one of these a long time ago.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Low tech, but really handy
customer_reviews.text: I really did not think that I would find these to be useful until I borrowed one from a friend. Yeah, the high-tech gizmos are better at showing you studs, wires and pipes; but when you are removing a section of drywall that you intend to replace these gadgets are wonderful at finding the screws or nails that you need to remove first. I highly recommend that you add one to your toolbox.
customer_reviews.author: Joe DTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Suggest to use a true electronic sensor for my rv wall
customer_reviews.text: Does not work well This item will go through most drywall to locate the studs; but does not do as well with plaster walls as they are thicker and plaster does not use as many nails. Plaster is the material that is put over the mesh, as opposed to using nails through the woour suggestion would be to use a true, electronic sensor that measures wood density.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi

customer_reviews.title: Just a magnet, what did you expect?
customer_reviews.text: This is a small magnet inside a piece of plastic. It's ok if the buyer realizes that's what it is. For me, it wasn't helpful for finding studs because it is too weak and too small. If this technique is what you want, it would be better to just buy a magnet, with more power than this one, hold it in your hand, and run your hand across the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased an electronic stud finder when I was preparing to mount my TV on the wall, and months later, I noticed the board I used to mount the TV to the wall had a gap in it, hence showing that I missed the stud. I quickly purchased a magnetic stud finder and was able to find the stud and secure the board even more. In the image attached, you can see the two screws that I missed and I drew a new line right above the magnetic stud finder. I would definitely choose this over the entry level electronic finders, at least.
customer_reviews.author: Hamdi C.

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Must-have gadget.
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical. I ordered anyway. This thing is so useful. I have an older home with a mixed bag of original and new construction. It works on nearly all l of it. I can see I have to be a little more careful on older stucco walls but it works even on those. I did try on one wall that must have been made using some metal lathing because it sticks everywhere on it. Oh well. Won’t be useful in that one spot. On newer hung drywall, it is a cinch. It sticks on the wall where the screws are. I highly recommend to any homeowner.
customer_reviews.author: MCRinOC

product_meta.title: CH Hanson 03040 Magnetic Stud Finder
product_meta.description:
Size:1 PackCH Hanson 03040 Magnetic stud finder

AMAZON.COM
The Stud 4 Sure is a stud finder that uses powerful rare earth magnets to pinpoint the exact location of screws or nails in a stud. The tool doesn’t require batteries and never needs calibration. By keeping the tool free of moving or electronic parts, the Stud 4 Sure is easy to use and fits easily into any tool pouch. Just place the stud finder on the wall and sweep in an "S" pattern to locate any metal fastener. The rare earth magnets are strong enough to allow Stud 4 Sure to hang hands-free on a wall, eliminating the need for pencil markings. The ergonomically designed, China made product is guaranteed to last a lifetime of being tossed, dropped, and banged around.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Positively locates nails and screws with powerful "neodymium" magnets. The magnetic stud finder works like magic. It sticks to the wall leaving your hands free--no batteries, no calibration, no lights, no hassle. It works on wood or metal studs, and uses multiple industrial strength magnets to “Field Vector” the stud. This is the last stud finder you will ever buy. Simply slide the flat surface of the magnetic stud finder slowly across a wall in a circular or "S" motion until you feel a strong pull to a nail head or screw. Once you have the magnetic stud finder directly above a nail head or screw, let it go and it sticks to the wall.

See more
feature_bullets: Small and compact, easily fits in pocket
Powerful magnets allows hands free use
2 way level for ease of marking
No batteries required. Scan Depth: 1 inch
Soft grip for easy grabbing and gentle touch

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars19,249 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
